ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to visualize 3D spaces and I learned Multivariable Calculus.
Understanding of multivariable calculus principles such as Stokes' Theorem, Green's Theorem, and the Fundamental Theorem of Line Integrals
Conceptualizing calculus in 3D and integration/differentiation techniques
calculus in a 3d perspective, improved note-taking and problem-solving skills

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The in person classes could be taught in a more clear manner, sometimes it was hard to follow. I liked how lesson videos were posted online, it helped a lot with staying up to date with the course. However, the pre-quizzes before every class were often 2-3 weeks ahead of what we were actually covering in class so sometimes it felt extremely disjointed and I didn't fully focus on the pre-quiz material because I knew we would not actually cover it for a long time.

Strengths: office hours, review session and peer tutoring were extremely helpful when I had questions about content
Weaknesses: material in class didn't always line up with other sections/pre-class quizzes, and often we could have spent more time covering difficult topics

Strengths: The pre-class videos are very helpful to have beforehand with the lecture
Weaknesses: The psets were too difficult to even grasp certain concepts, at one point you get burn out and instead of trying to understand the problem you are just focused on completing the problem. Also the final exam was not like the practice exams on Canvas.

strengths:
topic progression was helpful in reinforcing learned skills and grasping new skills

weaknesses:
improving the interface of the canvas website + making grades viewable to see our progress

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course, I think it is a good foundational course in Multivariable Calculus.
yes! especially if you have a knack for math or calculus. prior calculus knowledge and experience is greatly encouraged.
